data.meta_description: Ajinomoto// Ajinomoto DMF, CEP, Written Confirmations, FDF, Prices, Patents, Patents & Exclusivities, Dossier, Manufacturer, Licensing, Distributer, Suppliers, News Sodium glutamate, Ajinomoto, Glutacyl, Glutavene, Ancoma...
data.text:
PharmaCompass offers a list of Sodium Glutamate API manufacturers, exporters & distributors, which can be sorted by GMP, USDMF, JDMF, KDMF, CEP (COS), WC, Price,and more, enabling you to easily find the right Sodium Glutamate manufacturer or Sodium Glutamate supplier for your needs.

Send us enquiries for free, and we will assist you in establishing a direct connection with your preferred Sodium Glutamate manufacturer or Sodium Glutamate supplier.

PharmaCompass also assists you with knowing the Sodium Glutamate API Price utilized in the formulation of products. Sodium Glutamate API Price is not always fixed or binding as the Sodium Glutamate Price is obtained through a variety of data sources. The Sodium Glutamate Price can also vary due to multiple factors, including market conditions, regulatory modifications, or negotiated pricing deals.

A Ajinomoto manufacturer is defined as any person or entity involved in the manufacture, preparation, processing, compounding or propagation of Ajinomoto, including repackagers and relabelers. The FDA regulates Ajinomoto manufacturers to ensure that their products comply with relevant laws and regulations and are safe and effective to use. Ajinomoto API Manufacturers are required to adhere to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) to ensure that their products are consistently manufactured to meet established quality criteria.

A Ajinomoto supplier is an individual or a company that provides Ajinomoto active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) or Ajinomoto finished formulations upon request. The Ajinomoto suppliers may include Ajinomoto API manufacturers, exporters, distributors and traders.

click here to find a list of Ajinomoto suppliers with USDMF, JDMF, KDMF, CEP, GMP, COA and API Price related information on PharmaCompass.

A Ajinomoto DMF (Drug Master File) is a document detailing the whole manufacturing process of Ajinomoto active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) in detail. Different forms of Ajinomoto DMFs exist exist since differing nations have different regulations, such as Ajinomoto USDMF, ASMF (EDMF), JDMF, CDMF, etc.

A Ajinomoto DMF submitted to regulatory agencies in the US is known as a USDMF. Ajinomoto USDMF includes data on Ajinomoto's chemical properties, information on the facilities and procedures used, and details about packaging and storage. The Ajinomoto USDMF is kept confidential to protect the manufacturer’s intellectual property.

click here to find a list of Ajinomoto suppliers with USDMF on PharmaCompass.

Ajinomoto Active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) is produced in GMP-certified manufacturing facility.

GMP stands for Good Manufacturing Practices, which is a system used in the pharmaceutical industry to make sure that goods are regularly produced and monitored in accordance with quality standards. The FDA’s current Good Manufacturing Practices requirements are referred to as cGMP or current GMP which indicates that the company follows the most recent GMP specifications. The World Health Organization (WHO) has its own set of GMP guidelines, called the WHO GMP. Different countries can also set their own guidelines for GMP like China (Chinese GMP) or the EU (EU GMP).

PharmaCompass offers a list of Ajinomoto GMP manufacturers, exporters & distributors, which can be sorted by USDMF, JDMF, KDMF, CEP (COS), WC, API price, and more, enabling you to easily find the right Ajinomoto GMP manufacturer or Ajinomoto GMP API supplier for your needs.

A Ajinomoto CoA (Certificate of Analysis) is a formal document that attests to Ajinomoto's compliance with Ajinomoto specifications and serves as a tool for batch-level quality control.

Ajinomoto CoA mostly includes findings from lab analyses of a specific batch. For each Ajinomoto CoA document that a company creates, the USFDA specifies specific requirements, such as supplier information, material identification, transportation data, evidence of conformity and signature data.

Ajinomoto may be tested according to a variety of international standards, such as European Pharmacopoeia (Ajinomoto EP), Ajinomoto JP (Japanese Pharmacopeia) and the US Pharmacopoeia (Ajinomoto USP).
